Home / Interviews / Interviews by Conference / WindyCityRails 2012

WindyCityRails 2012

WindyCityRails 2012 brings together 15 interviews from 2012. Recurring themes include Ruby and Rails practice, conference speaking and presentation skills, and community building and user-group organizing. Featured interviewees include Adam Grandy, Amy Kinney, Benjamin Oakes, and Brian Liles.

  • Coverage: 15 interviews from 2012.
  • Featured interviewees: Adam Grandy, Amy Kinney, Benjamin Oakes, Brian Liles, and Eric MacAdie.
  • Common themes: Ruby and Rails practice, conference speaking and presentation skills, community building and user-group organizing, conference AV production and audio best practices, and podcasting and community media.

Trusted Sources

Notable Contributors

  • Evan Light Interview
Interview with Noel Rappin at WindyCityRails 2012
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Noel Rappin
Topic: conference speaking and presentation skills
Duration: 8 min · Uploaded: Sep 12, 2012
Conference: WindyCityRails 2012
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview noel-rappin conference windy-city-rails chicago-ruby windycityrails-2012 ruby rails community conference-speaking-and-presentation-skills
Video description: Noel Rappin has a long history speaking and teaching even before he joined the TDD community. Noel has co-authored books for Python, Ruby+Rails and now he’s focusing on teaching testing concepts in JavaScript through the “Master Space and Time With JavaScript” series.

Video description: Evan Light created the very cool Ruby DCamp “unconference” that takes techies out from their urban confines and get’s them out to code & collaborate in the great wilderness outside of D.C.
Interview with Steve Klabnik at WindyCityRails 2012
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Steve Klabnik
Topic: ruby and rails practice
Duration: 13 min · Uploaded: Sep 12, 2012
Conference: WindyCityRails 2012
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview steve-klabnik conference windy-city-rails chicago-ruby windycityrails-2012 ruby rails community javascript ruby-and-rails-practice
Video description: While most tech conference speakers tend to present on purely technical content, Steve Klabnik likes to take a more thoughtful approach to the software industry. Steve presented on Literate Code at WindyCityRails 2011 and in 2012 presented Development and Philosophy. I think it’s very worthwhile to spend at least a bit of time thinking *about* our industry as it relates to us personally and to society at large is a very good thing.

Interview with Adam Grandy at WindyCityRails 2012
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Adam Grandy
Topic: podcasting and community media
Duration: 8 min · Uploaded: Sep 11, 2012
Conference: WindyCityRails 2012
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview adam-grandy windy-city-rails chicago-ruby conference-operations av-production audio-engineering community conference windycityrails-2012 ruby rails podcasting-and-community-media
Video description: Not everyone who is involved in running a technical user-conference is a programmer. Adam Grandy is the “A-V Guy” for the WindyCityRails conference. While most of us are watching the conference for entertainment and education, Adam is carefully watching every second of the conference to keep the speaker in focus and make sure that all the valuable information that’s being shared is captured in high-quality, professional-level video. Adam is one of those unsung people that puts in a great deal of
